The Nintendo Switch has so many amazing indie titles that can be considered some of the best games on the system.

There are a lot of them, so instead of sifting through that eShop, we’ve made a list of 90 of the best indie titles that simply must be played by any indie gaming enthusiast (as of December, 2019). Nintendo has taken a positive direction with regards to making it easier for indie game developers to make games, and it shows! 

Disclaimer: We are only listing titles that we have personally played as we do not believe in putting a game on a list that we have not personally experienced. Therefore, there may be a few notable exclusions (such as Limbo and Darkest Dungeon), but we will try our best to get to them and consider them for our future when we update the list in May. If there are any games that you believe should be a candidate for this list, please let us know by emailing us at team@switchaboo.com.

90. Mighty Gunvolt Burst

Developed By INTI CREATES CO., LTD.
Published By INTI CREATES CO., LTD.
Genre Action / Platformer
Rating E
Players 1

Remember Beck? You know, the main character from that Kickstarter game Mighty No. 9. Well guess what? He’s in a good game this time! Yes, Mighty Gunvolt Burst combines Beck with the Azure Striker Gunvolt series to make a classic style Megamanesque 2D platformer.

89. Tumbleseed

Developed By Team TumbleSeed
Published By aeiowu
Genre Action / Adventure
Rating E
Players 1 – 2

This game is an anxiety-inducing experience that simply must be played to appreciate. The goal is to balance a seed on a tightrope as you avoid obstacles and pitfalls. The sheer uniqueness of Tumbleseed, along with its colourful art style, certainly makes it stand out amongst the ever-growing list of indie titles on the Switch.

88. Kamiko

Published By Flyhigh Works
Genre Action / Arcade
Rating E
Players 1

This game is for when your grandparents don’t know what to give you for your birthday, and your parents tell them that you would like a game for your “Nintendo”, but they have no clue when it comes to games so they give you an eShop card. After you use it to buy an expensive game, what are you going to do with the remaining $5? You buy Kamiko, of course! This indie darling is similar to topdown Legend of Zelda games with an arcade twist. Battle demons, solve puzzles and break all the seals to face off against various stage bosses.

87. Graceful Explosion Machine

Developed By Vertex Pop
Published By Vertex Pop
Genre Action / Arcade / Shooter
Rating E
Players 1

This shoot ‘em up indie has you controlling the GEM fighter in order to blast your way through alien worlds. Collect jewels for high scores and feel every shot with HD Rumble to be truly engrossed in this wacky arcade shooter.

86. Thimbleweed Park

Developed By Terrible Toybox, Inc.
Published By Terrible Toybox
Genre Adventure / Puzzle
Rating T
Players 1

From the creators of the phenomenon Monkey Island, Ron Gilbert and Gary Winnick have made another masterpiece with Thimbleweed Park. This game takes place in a town of the same name and is set in neo-noir 1987. Play as five characters, all trying to uncover mysteries of murder and terror. With serious themes coupled alongside witty humour, this indie title will bring out a range of emotions as it encapsulates the magical storytelling from Gilbert and Winnick.

85. Severed

Developed By DrinkBox Studios
Published By DrinkBox Studios
Genre Action / RPG
Rating 
Players 1

Developed by the same company that brought us Guacamelee, Severed utilizes their iconic artstyle with a twist in gameplay. Use touch screen controls to slash at enemies with precision and timing. This first-person dungeon crawler is bursting with personality and is definitely one to consider if you like to play the Switch in handheld mode.

84. Mimpi Dreams

Developed By doinksoft
Published By Devolver Digital
Genre Action / Adventure / Platformer
Rating E
Players 1

Mimpi is a lazy dog. He likes to sleep a lot but in his dreams, he can be whatever he wants to be and go wherever he wants to go. In his dreams, Mimpi can be the star of the show, the hero of the narrative, collecting dog bones and solving puzzles. Where does this lead to you might ask? Well back to his own bed, of course!

If you’d like to learn more about Mimpi Dreams, click here to read our review.

83. Poi: Explorer Edition

Developed By PolyKid
Published By PolyKid
Genre Platformer / Adventure
Rating E
Players 1

For those who grew up in the golden age of 3D platformers, this game will surely seem familiar. Poi is an ambitious title that takes inspiration from classic Mario and Banjo-Kazooie games on the Nintendo 64. Embark on a grand adventure across many worlds, and don’t forget to pick up those many collectibles along the way!

If you’d like to know more about this game, then click here to read our review of Poi.

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com.au/POE-SWI-Poi-Explorer-Edition/dp/B0763HLN1T/ref=sr_1_3?keywords=poi+switch&qid=1564569296&s=gateway&sr=8-3″ target=”blank” style=”3d” background=”#2a17b3″ size=”8″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy Poi Explorer Edition from Amazon[/su_button]

82. Jotun

Developed By Thunder Lotus Games
Published By Thunder Lotus Games
Genre Action / Adventure
Rating T
Players 1

Jotun: Valhalla Edition is a beautifully hand-drawn action game that immerses you in Norse mythology. Thora, a female viking warrior who has suffered an inglorious death, must prove herself to the Gods in order to enter Valhalla. Featuring nine levels filled to the brim with Viking mythology, take down ferocious Jotuns (giant Norse elementals) with Thora’s two-handed axe and powers bestowed upon her by the gods.

81. Pawarumi

Developed By Manufacture 43
Published By Manufacture 43
Genre Action / Arcade
Rating E10+
Players 1

Pawarumi is adrenaline-pumping, innovative and surprisingly captivating! It takes what is great about the arcade shoot ’em up genre and provides just enough to give it its own sense of unique flare. I just wish I knew more about what was actually happening in terms of context and despite its smooth gameplay, a performance update during the brief intermissions could do Pawarumi’s overall appeal wonders.

If you’d like to learn more about Pawarumi, click here to read our review.

80. Pool Panic

Developed By Rekim
Published By Adult Swim Games
Genre Adventure / Multiplayer / Party / Puzzle
Rating E10+
Players 1 – 4

Don’t panic, it’s only pool. But it’s pool in a wacky world full of crazy scenarios. Run around as a cue ball and pot all of the other balls, including: raccoon balls who will only come down when you’ve knocked the meat off of the barbecue grill and ballerina balls who glide away when you aim at them. Pool Panic contains that Adult Swim vibe that may seem familiar from many wacky cartoons, and this game bursts with so much personality that it’ll all oddly make sense in the end.

If you’d like to learn more about Pool Panic, click here to read our Quick Review.

79. Velocity 2X

Developed By FuturLab
Published By Curve Digital
Genre Shooter / Action / Platformer / Arcade
Rating E10+
Players 1

Velocity 2X combines fast-paced SHMUP action with 2D platforming, allowing you to fly into areas that has you to take down the enemy from the inside. Play as Lt. Kai Tana and take down the enemy aliens known as Vokh who had conducted cybernetics modifications on her body. Use these new power ups to take them down and protect your newly founded allies. Including all DLC and daily challenges, this indie darling is packed full of fast-paced content.

Projection: First Light

Developed By Shadowplay Studios
Published By Blowfish Studios
Genre Shooter / Action / Platformer / Arcade
Rating E
Players 1

Enter the world of shadow puppeteering as a young girl named Greta who can manipulate light to travel to far off lands. In Projection: First Light, experience a variety of cultures and embrace their artistic approaches to the practise as the mischievous Greta chases a butterfly into a Shadow Theatre where her world takes many new forms before her very eyes.

Click here to read our review of Projection: First Light

78. Black Future ‘88

Developed By SuperScarySnakes
Published By Gambitious
Genre Action / Adventure / Multiplayer
Rating T
Players 1 – 2

The year is 1988; well, it may as well be as the world stopped keeping track of time after the nuclear fallout. The sun is now blacked out and the only thing left to do is take down Duncan, the mastermind of it all. In Black Future ’88, you’ll make your way up a procedurally-generated tower to put an end to Duncan’s reign of terror.

If you’d like to learn more about Black Future ‘88, click here to read our review.

77. Splasher

Developed By Splashteam
Published By Plug In Digital
Genre Platformer / Arcade / Action
Rating T
Players 1

Splasher is an incredibly challenging 2D platformer that takes place in a construction factory that is conducting some shady business. Put and end to it and stop the mad scientist by shooting different color ink in order to stick on to or bounce off of walls. Just imagine Splatoon as a 2D platformer.

Evergate

Developed By Stone Lantern Games
Published By PQube
Genre Platformer / Adventure / Puzzle
Rating T
Players 1

Evergate tells a captivating story about a white wisp named Ki travelling through the afterlife and going through the Evergate itself to relive the memories of those long since past. Utilise the power of the crystals within the Evergate in order to solve challenging puzzle platform segments whilst learning more about the nature of the afterlife.

Click here to read our review of Evergate

Hotshot Racing

Published By Curve Digital
Genre Arcade / Racing
Rating E
Players 1 – 8

Gear up and take in those sweet waves of nostalgia as Hotshot Racing attempts to bring back the classic arcade racing genre from the 90s. With four tourneys, eight racers, online and additional modes, all running at a smooth 1080p 60FPS with a clean retro polygonal aesthetic, Hotshot Racing provides a lot of promise to those who thrived in arcades three decades ago.

Click here to read our review of Hotshot Racing

Going Under

Developed By Aggro Crab Games
Published By Team17
Genre Action / Fighting / Roguelike
Rating T
Players 1

The life of a successful startup is a common tale, but not when said startup is built above other failed startups and your goal as an intern is to delve below in order to fight off the aggressive monsters below and obtain their relics for… reasons. Going Under‘s third person roguelike action with a bright and bubbly theme offers its own brand of gameplay setting and its humour correlates fantastically.

Click here to read our review of Going Under

76. Thumper

Developed By Drool
Published By Drool LLC 
Genre Action / Music / Arcade
Rating E10+
Players 1

As soon as you boot this one up, you’ll realise that Thumper sets out to purely overstimulate your senses. It’s a rhythm game that requires your unwavering attention with its original fast-tempo tracks and reflex-testing obstacles.

75. Mighty Switch Force! Collection

Developed By WayForward
Published By WayForward
Genre Action / Adventure / Platformer / Puzzle
Rating E10+
Players 1 – 4

The Mighty Switch Force! Collection is a well done compilation of the series to date, allowing fans of the series to traverse it all again with one last purchase and newcomers to delve right in with all that the series has to offer. The series offers some well designed puzzles that offer more skill-based challenges than mental ones, but this may be just the right amount of difficulty for those wanting some straightforward pick up and play action.

If you’d like to learn more about Mighty Switch Force! Collection, click here to read our review.

74. Fast RMX

Developed By Shin’en
Published By Shin’en
Genre Racing / Action / Arcade
Rating E
Players 1 – 4
Players (Local / Online) 2 – 8

Some of you may have played Fast Racing Neo on the Wii U. If so, then this game might seem a little familiar. Fast Racing RMX combines fast action-packed racing with futuristic graphics and smooth controls. Even though fans have been screaming for a new F-Zero game for over a decade now, at least we have this indie gem to tie us over.

73. Minit

Developed By JW, Kitty, Jukio, and Dom
Published By Devolver Digital
Genre Action / Adventure
Rating E
Players 1

Minit is a black and white action adventure game akin to classic Legend of Zelda games. But there’s a twist: You only get 60 seconds until you die and are sent back to the house. Get to the bottom of the cursed swords by gaining hints and uncovering your next move. Use the time that you have to make quick progress, and save the world one minute at a time.

If you’d like to know more about this game, then click here to read our Quick Review.

72. Electronic Super Joy

Developed By Michael Todd Games
Published By Hard Copy Games
Genre Action / Arcade / Music / Platformer
Rating M
Players 1

Electronic Super Joy is a challenging 2D platformer that has you preparing to die a lot. With its upbeat music and array of flashing colours, make your way through psychedelic levels that will test your skills like never before. Oh, and take down the evil Pope… that’s important.

If you’d like to learn more about Electronic Super Joy, click here to read our review.

71. Gorogoa

Developed By Buried Signal
Published By Annapurna Interactive
Genre Puzzle / Adventure
Rating E
Players 1

Gorogoa is an artistic puzzle game that is laid out on a square with four images. The player must delve deeper into each image to find connections with each other. Guide the young boy across various religious and spiritual themes in a 20th century European setting.

If you’d like to know more about this game, then click here to read our Quick Review.

70. Night in the Woods

Developed By Infinite Fall
Published By Finji
Genre Adventure / Platformer
Rating T
Players 1

Night in the Woods may seem cute and fluffy with its stylistic design, but it contains more mature themes than you’d initially expect. This game brings up everyday issues of local businesses and the pressures of adulthood. Explore a vibrant world and talk to the furry residents to reveal some truly deep and emotional moments.

69. West of Loathing

Developed By Asymmetric
Published By Asymmetric
Genre Adventure / RPG
Rating T
Players 1

Don’t let West of Loathing’s simplistic art style fool you, there is so much more to this game that what appears on the surface. Combat is surprisingly deep and the world contains much to explore and discover. But where this game truly shines is in its dialogue. With witty banter set in a classic western, West of Loathing will actually make you laugh out loud. Play one of three character classes and fight back as the cows have literally come home.

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com/West-Loathing-Nintendo-Switch/dp/B07P9TBZFR/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=West+of+Loathing+nintendo+switch&qid=1554615748&s=gateway&sr=8-1″ target=”blank” background=”#f64201″ size=”10″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy West of Loathing from Amazon[/su_button]

68. Screencheat: Unplugged

Developed By Samurai Punk
Published By Samurai Punk
Genre Action / Arcade / Party / First-Person Shooter
Rating E10+
Players 2-4

Think Goldeneye 007, but everyone is invisible. Screencheat: Unplugged has is a local multi-player game with classic first-person deathmatch gameplay. All of the arenas are colour-coated, requiring you to look at your opponents squares in order to determine their approximate locations. Once you think you’ve got them, unleash hell into nowhere and hope that you hit them before they hit you.

67. Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon

Developed By INTI CREATES CO., LTD.
Published By INTI CREATES CO., LTD.
Genre Action / Platformer
Rating T
Players 1

Inti Creates is responsible for some of the most memorable Nindies, and Curse of the Moon continues that trend by paying homage to classic side-scrolling Castlevania games. This title keeps the core gameplay elements of the series like platforming, boss fights, and falling backwards into pits, but eases newcomers in with some needed difficulty settings. Experienced players might still find the “veteran” setting too easy, but the post-game which restricts your party should alleviate any of those concerns, and helps keep the experience fresh. It’s short, but stands as a great appetizer to the upcoming Ritual of the Night.

66. Forager

Developed By HopFrog
Published By Humble Bundle
Genre Adventure / Simulation / Strategy / Puzzle
Rating E
Players 1

Forager is a beautifully crafted and wonderfully addictive game; one where you go to bed at 11pm, take out your Switch for ten minutes and realise it’s suddenly 3am. Most of its shortcomings can seemingly be fixed with patch updates, providing a better quality of life experience, but as it stands at the time of this review, they keep the game from reaching its potential.

If you’d like to learn more about Forager, click here to read our review.

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com/Forager-Nintendo-Switch/dp/B07V8KNRJF/ref=sr_1_4?keywords=forager+switch&qid=1564570009&s=gateway&sr=8-4″ target=”blank” style=”3d” background=”#2a17b3″ size=”8″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy Forager from Amazon[/su_button]

65. The Swords of Ditto: Mormo’s Quest

Developed By onebitbeyond
Published By Devolver Digital
Genre Action / Adventure
Rating E10+
Players 1 – 2

The Sword of Ditto: Mormo’s Curse is an action-adventure game that is akin to classic topdown games of the 90s. The game tells the story of heroes of the sword on a mission to take down the evil Mormo, one that spans across many generations and many heroes.

If you’d like to learn more about The Swords of Ditto: Mormo’s Quest, click here to read our review.

64. Dust: An Elysian Tail

Developed By BOOTDISK REVOLUTION
Published By Digerati
Genre Action / Adventure / Fighting / Platformer
Rating T
Players 1 – 2

Dust: An Elysian Tail lets you go on a wondrous journey that is beautifully hand-painted and bursting with color. Play as Dust, a warrior with a warped memory, alongside the mythical Blade of Ahrah and the blade’s guardian, Fidget. This indie features a rich combat system with RPGlike upgrade systems along with the ability to craft your own weapons and armor. Dust: An Elysian Tail is also fully voice acted and makes the world feel so much more alive with personality.

63. Sparklite

Developed By RedBlue Games
Published By Merge Games
Genre Action / Adventure
Rating E10+
Players 1 – 2

Sparklite is a topdown roguelike action adventure game with a charming pixel art style. Play as Ada, alongside her plucky robot friend, and stop the Baron from using the ore known as Sparklite for evil purposes. With the ability to repurpose Sparklite on top of the airship known as The Refuge, drop down to the polluted world of Geodia and take down titan bosses to free the world of its curses.

If you’d like to learn more about Sparklite, click here to read our review.

62. Pikuniku

Developed By Sectordub
Published By Devolver Digital
Genre Puzzle / Platformer / Adventure
Rating E
Players 1 – 2

Pikuniku is a physics-based puzzle-platformer that takes place in a happy world riddled with sinister plots. As a red blob with legs, talk to interesting characters, undertake strange requests and explore a colourful world full of charm and personality.

If you’d like to learn more about Pikuniku, click here to read/watch our review.

61. Creature in the Well

Developed By Flight School Studio
Published By Flight School Studio
Genre Action / Adventure / Arcade / Puzzle
Rating E
Players 1

This roguelite hack & slash dungeon crawler takes a pinball inspiration, having the player delve through dungeons and using your sword to charge up and hit energy orbs to have them ricochet from bumper to bumper. Set out to restore power to the ancient facility that is now haunted by a Creature in the Well (sound familiar?). Get ready to combine one of the newest genres with one of the oldest!

60. Gato Roboto

Developed By doinksoft
Published By Devolver Digital
Genre Action / Adventure / Platformer
Rating E
Players 1

Gato Roboto is a classically-inspired 2D metroidvania that has you controlling a cat in a mech suit. As crazy as that may sound, the cat is actually being controlled remotely by the injured captain in his ship that has crash landed on a remote planet. Explore uncharted territories, upgrade your equipment and delve deeper into uncovering the dark mysteries that dwell within.

If you’d like to learn more about Gato Roboto, click here to read our review.

Heroes of Hammerwatch: Ultimate Edition

Developed By Crackshell
Published By Blitworks
Genre Action / Adventure / Roguelike
Rating T
Players 1 – 4

Heroes of Hammerwatch is a procedurally-generated dungeon crawler, having you battle hordes of enemies as you work your way to the very top of the Forsaken Spire. Go in, grab all the loot you can find and make sure to bring it back up to the surface before you die because in the mines, your gold will be lost forever.

Click here to read our Quick Review of Heroes of Hammerwatch: Ultimate Edition

59. SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech

Developed By Image & Form
Published By Thunderful Publishing
Genre RPG / Adventure
Rating E
Players 1

In SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech, travel through a whimsical land filled with fantasy and steamboats, swords and magic, dragons and snoody guild members who have forgotten what it means to be a true hero. The combat is familiar turn-based RPG, much different to what Image & Form have ever done in the past.

If you’d like to learn more about SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech, click here to read our review.

58. OXENFREE

Developed By Night School Studio
Published By Night School Studio
Genre Adventure
Rating T
Players 1

Set on an old abandoned military island, a group of teenagers spend a night to get away from their troubles. However as the night progresses, ghosts of the island’s past begin to terrorise the group, possessing their bodies and forcing them to face their fears. Each decision that you make can alter the outcome of the story and the relationships with the characters. OXENFREE is an award-winning game that simply must be played by anyone who loves a good scary story.

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com/Oxenfree-Nintendo-Switch/dp/B07KMHGN4L/ref=sr_1_2?keywords=oxenfree+nintendo+switch&qid=1554616890&s=gateway&sr=8-2″ target=”blank” background=”#f64201″ size=”10″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy OXENFREE from Amazon[/su_button]

57. Enter the Gungeon

Developed By Dodge Roll
Published By Devolver Digital
Genre Action / Adventure / Arcade
Rating T
Players 1 – 2

Enter the Gungeon is a unique dungeon crawler that pits you against hordes of enemies and big baddies in order to find the gun that can kill the past. With seven heroes to choose from and an array of guns to fight with, you’ll be gunning down enemies for hours on end!

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com/Enter-Gungeon-Deluxe-Nintendo-Switch/dp/B07S226BXT/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=enter+the+Gungeon+switch&qid=1561723123&s=gateway&sr=8-1″ target=”blank” style=”3d” background=”#2a17b3″ size=”8″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy Enter the Gungeon from Amazon[/su_button]

56. Wonder Boy: The Dragon’s Trap

Developed By Lizardcube
Published By DotEmu
Genre Adventure / Action / Platformer / Other
Rating E10+
Players 1

Wonder Boy: The Dragon’s Trap is a wonderful recreation of the classic Wonder Boy III: The Dragon’s Trap (basically the same name) on the Sega Master System. This indie darling features beautiful recreations of its artwork and music, with the ability to go back to the old retro style on a whim. Play as a boy (or as a girl in this remake) who gets inflicted with curses that transforms him/her into various animals, each with their own unique abilities. This remake is a love letter to retro gaming and a gift to fans of simpler times.

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com.au/Wonder-Boy-The-Dragons-Trap/dp/B07CKGYJ14/ref=sr_1_fkmrnull_3?keywords=wonder+boy+the+dragon%27s+trap+nintendo+switch&qid=1554628612&s=gateway&sr=8-3-fkmrnull” target=”blank” background=”#f64201″ size=”10″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy Wonder Boy: The Dragon’s Trap from Amazon[/su_button]

Don’t forget to like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for more Nintendo Switch content. Also, please consider supporting us on Patreon so that we can continue to do what we love doing.

55. Crypt of the Necrodancer

Developed By Brace Yourself Games
Published By Brace Yourself
Genre RPG / Music / Action / Other
Rating T
Players 1 – 2

Crypt of the Necrodancer is an indie game that combines rhythm gaming with RPG action dungeon crawling. As much as that may sound like an odd mismatch, it somehow works so well to create an incredibly unique gaming experience. You have fallen deep down into a dungeon and you need to recapture your still beating heart that beats to the rhythm of the music. Fight your way through procedurally-generated dungeons and get to the end in order to slay the NecroDancer.

54. Yooka-Laylee

Developed By Playtonic Games
Published By Team17 Digital Ltd
Genre Platformer / Adventure / Action
Rating E10+
Players 1 – 4

Want some more 3D platforming goodness? Then look no further than Yooka-Laylee! From a team largely built on many ex-Rare employees, Playtonic Games brings us a beautiful 3D platformer in the same vein as Banjo-Kazooie and Conker’s Bad Fur Day. With the soundtrack composed by Grant Kirkhope himself, you’ll feel just like a kid again collecting pagies and fast-forwarding through those dialogue grunts and squawks.

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com/Yooka-Laylee-Collectors-Limited-Nintendo-Switch-Swtich/dp/B07PHK5KJC/ref=sr_1_fkmrnull_2?crid=117A5Z4CS5ODI&keywords=nintendo+switch+yooka+laylee&qid=1554617747&s=gateway&sprefix=Yooka-+nintendo+switch%2Caps%2C528&sr=8-2-fkmrnull” target=”blank” background=”#f64201″ size=”10″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy Yooka-Laylee Collector’s Edition from Amazon[/su_button]

53. LUMINES REMASTERED

Developed By Resonair
Published By Enhance
Genre Puzzle / Arcade
Rating E
Players 1-2

LUMINES REMASTERED is a classic indie that has been remastered for the Nintendo Switch. The blocks contain two separate colours and you want to align your next block so that you can match them up in order to score big combos. Sounds easy? Well, don’t get ahead of yourself! LUMINES REMASTERED offers challenging but addictive gameplay, perfect for any puzzle fans or anyone just needing to kill ten minutes on the train.

[su_button url=”https://www.amazon.com/Lumines-Remastered-Switch-Limited-Run-Nintendo/dp/B07SBGJSHJ/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=lumines+remastered+switch&qid=1561723297&s=gateway&sr=8-1″ target=”blank” style=”3d” background=”#2a17b3″ size=”8″ center=”yes” text_shadow=”0px 0px 0px #000000″]Buy LUMINES REMASTERED from Amazon[/su_button]

52. Slay the Spire

Developed By Mega Crit
Published By Humble Bundle
Genre Action / RPG / Strategy
Rating E10+
Players 1

Slay the Spire is a turn-based roguelike with card game elements. Build the best deck that you can put together and fight your way up an ever-changing Spire that provides each playthrough with its own challenges, enemies and boss battles.

If you’d like to learn more about Slay the Spire, click here to read our review.

51. A Hat in Time

Developed By Gears for Breakfast
Published By Humble Bundle
Genre Action / Adventure / Platformer
Rating T
Players 1 – 2

The 3D platforming genre is one that can be difficult for an indie studio to create and when the attempt is made, it’s difficult to say how it will turn out. A Hat in Time is one of those attempts that features a small top hat-wearing girl who has lost her source of fuel (Time Pieces) and must now venture to retrieve them all whilst making many frenemies along the way.

If you’d like to learn more about A Hat in Time, click here to read our review.

50. Unruly Heroes

Developed By Magic Design Studios
Published By Magic Design Studios
Genre Action / Platformer / Fighting / Puzzle
Rating E10+
Players 1 – 4

Set in a world inspired by the classic tale “Journey to the West”, Unruly Heroes has you swapping between four heroes in order to save the land from an endless night. As an action-platformer, you’ll be taking down your enemies and overcoming some challenging platforming areas, but only if your reflexes are quick enough.

If you’d like to learn more about Unruly Heroes, click here to read our review.

49. River City Girls

Developed By WayForward
Published By WayForward
Genre Adventure / Arcade / Fighting / Multiplayer
Rating E10+
Players 1 – 2

River City Girls is an old school beat ’em up about two high school girls who want nothing more than to find their kidnapped boyfriends. Upon receiving a text message about this heinous crime, the bubbly Kyoko and the hot-headed Misako break out of detention and take down anyone who gets in their way, including the yakuza.

If you’d like to learn more about River City Girls, click here to read our review.

48. Wandersong

Developed By Greg Lobanov
Published By Humble Bumble
Genre Adventure / Platformer / Music
Rating E
Players 1

In so many video games, you play as the chosen hero who brandishes a sword and saves the world by slaying everything that crosses their path. Developed By Game Atelier
Published By FDG Entertainment
Genre Action / Adventure / Platformer / RPG
Rating E10+
Players 1

Monster Boy and the Cursed Kingdom is the long awaited spiritual successor to the Wonder Boy series that released on the Sega Master System and Mega Drive in the late 80s and early 90s. The last new game in the series was Monster World IV on April 1, 1994 and was only released in Japan. So despite Wonder Boy: The Dragon’s Trap, a remake of the original that released on all current-gen consoles in 2017, fans have been craving a new entry – and now that wait is finally over. The game’s art style is beautiful and the classic concept of switching through monsters, each with their own unique abilities, is ingeniously implemented.

1. Hollow Knight

Developed By Team Cherry
Published By Team Cherry
Genre Action / Adventure / Platformer
Rating E10+
Players 1

Hollow Knight is a Metroidvania style platformer that can arguably be compared to such titles that coined the genre itself. Guide Hollow Knight through the ruins of Hallownest, an ancient civilization that is overrun with those who remain. Absorb their souls and use it to heal and cause devastating attacks as you continue to delve deeper into the danger that lurks. Team Cherry’s passion project shines in it visual presentation, with jaw-dropping aesthetics and attention to detail. The combat and movement is incredibly fluid, running at 1080P/60FPS on Nintendo Switch.
